top_categories.workout_context: Kettle Mettle rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Kettle Mettle’s bc mountains, canadian gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Kettle Mettle when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Racing Kettle Mettle isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Kettle Mettle. Make this intensity feel like home.
Kettle Mettle’s bc mountain gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
At 80 miles, Kettle Mettle punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Kettle Mettle’s 7,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Kettle Mettle — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for Kettle Mettle — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.
Every session at Kettle Mettle intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Kettle Mettle — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on bc mountain gravel.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Kettle Mettle’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Kettle Mettle. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Kettle Mettle requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on bc mountain gravel to build confidence. Expect: bc mountains, canadian gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Over Under to prepare you for 80 miles of bc mountain gravel in British Columbia, Canada.
